definition: to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
variegated/heterogeneous/to refute/to contradict/to ship by barge/a barge/a lighter (ship)
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: This congressman is clever at making scores off hecklers at public meetings.
sentences.chinese: 這位國會議員擅長在公衆集會上駁倒詰難者。

sentences.english: The lawyer confuted the testimony of the witness by showing actual photographs of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 律師出示那次事故的真實照片，駁倒了證人的證言。

sentences.english: I may be able to score him off.
It is quite difficult for skeptics to refute the existence of ghosts simply because of ghosts' nature.
sentences.chinese: 因鬼魂的特性所致，質疑者很難駁倒鬼魂存在論。

sentences.english: He bowled down his opponent in the debate.
sentences.chinese: 他在辯論中徹底駁倒了對方。

sentences.english: He had little difficulty in talking the slanderer down.
sentences.chinese: 他以事實和數字爲後盾毫不費力地駁倒了誹謗者。

sentences.english: The evidence demolished the attorney's case.
sentences.chinese: 那證據駁倒了律師提出的理由。

sentences.english: He bested her in the argument.
Therefore there is an external world and sceptism is refuted.
sentences.chinese: 因此外在世界的存在駁倒了懷疑論。

sentences.english: He has a glib tongue. Few people can argue him down.
sentences.chinese: 他有三寸不爛之舌，幾乎沒人能駁倒他。

sentences.english: I retorted, showing a decided purple witness to refute her.
sentences.chinese: 我回嘴，指着我明擺着的紫斑作爲見證來駁倒她。

sentences.english: He was unable to confute the debater.
sentences.chinese: 他未能駁倒對方的辯論者。

sentences.english: The census disproves these claims completely.
sentences.chinese: 但是，這份調查徹底駁倒了他的言論。

sentences.english: The best antiquaries have now confuted Homer.
sentences.chinese: 最好的考古學者已經將荷馬駁倒了。

sentences.english: He had no difficulty in ague his teacher down.
sentences.chinese: 他毫無困難地駁倒了老師。

sentences.english: She disposed of the arguments against her plan in two sentences .
sentences.chinese: 她用三言兩語就駁倒了反對她的計劃的論點。

definition: hiding place/hideout
to whisper to one another's ear
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
to make friends again/to renew old cordial relations
willingly and gladly (idiom)
to obstruct/to impede
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
paper wedding (first year wedding anniversary)
to bow before (idiom)/to capitulate
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
a short time/a little while
proud and arrogant
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
